#Text=Ii Naotora
#Text=In this Japanese name , the family name is Ii .
#Text=Ii Naotora ( 井伊 直虎 , d. 12 September 1582 ) was a daimyō of the Sengoku period .
#Text=She was the daughter and only child of Ii Naomori , the eighteenth head of their clan .
#Text=She was primarily the head of Ii clan and retainer of the Imagawa clan , because of her efforts , Ii Naotora becomes a daimyō and received the title " Female Landlord " ( 女地頭 ) . [ 1 ]
#Text=As a relative of Lady Tsukiyama ( first consort of Tokugawa Ieyasu ) , Naotora switched sides to the Matsudaira clan of Mikawa province .
#Text=The Ii clan that Naotora as guardian of Ii Naomasa protected , prospered for over 200 years and became one of the main samurai clans that formed the Tokugawa Shogunate government .
#Text=Early life
#Text=Ii Naotora was a daughter of Ii Naomori , a leader of Iinoya-is a part of Tōtōmi , who had been defeated by Imagawa Yoshimoto and became a vassal of Imagawa .
#Text=The Ii family had no male heir , so Natora 's uncle Ii Naomitsu tried to betrothe Ii Naochika his son to her so that he could inherit the clan .
#Text=However , Naomitsu planned to rebel against Imagawa .
#Text=Unidentified Imagawa clan retainers carried a report of the plans to Imagawa , who ordered Naomitsu and his son Naochika to commit seppuku .
#Text=Naomitsu died , but Naochika , who was very young , was protected by a Buddhist priest named Nankei .
#Text=Naochika managed to flee to Shinano .
#Text=Naotora became a priestess , and was named Jirō Hōshi ( 次郎法師 ) at age of ten by Nankei .
#Text=Naomori and Yoshimoto died in the Battle of Okehazama in 1560 , Imagawa clan loses power and the province goes into chaos .
#Text=Naochika returned to Iinoya about ten years later after he left , he had already married another woman while in exile and could not marry Jiro Hoshi .
#Text=Naochika momentarily ruled the clan but , like his father , he planned a rebellion against Imagawa .
#Text=Again , anonymous traitors carried news of the plans to Imagawa and Naochika was killed by Imagawa Ujizane in 1560 .
#Text=It is said that he was killed because of an anonymous report of Ono Michiyoshi .
#Text=In 1563 , Ii Naohira ( Naotora 's grandfather ) and other men from Ii , were ordered to break into Hikuma Castle as proof of their loyalty to Imagawa .
#Text=Otazu no kata who was wife of Iio Tsurutatsu ( lord of Hikuma castle ) invited Naohira to a meeting with her husband and planned to eradicate it to claim prominence in Totomi .
#Text=In September 18 , Otazu no Kata then poisoned Naohira 's tea and he died soon after .

#Text=Following Naohira 's death and many obstacles , Jiro Hoshi returned to secular life , removed her nun costume , was baptized by the male name Naotora and became the nominal head of the Ii clan .
#Text=Reign
#Text=She adopted Naochika 's daughter and son , Takase and Ii Naomasa .
#Text=Naotora secured Naomasa 's future successful career when he succeeds her .
#Text=During the early days of her reign , Naotora often tried to mediate with Imagawa Ujizane and his grandmother Jukei-ni , at which time the Imagawa clan was on warpath with Ii clan .
#Text=Former Imagawa clan retainer Tokugawa Ieyasu went to war with Ujizane .
#Text=Ieyasu was successful in forming an alliance with Oda Nobunaga after Yoshimoto 's death in 1560 .
#Text=Ieyasu 's wife was Lady Tsukiyama , who was from the Imagawa family and related to Naotora . [ 2 ] [ 3 ]

#Text=In 1564 Niino Chikanori , a retainer of Ii clan , led a siege to Hikuma castle to prove Naotora 's loyalty to Imagawa Ujizane , Otazu and Tsurutatsu fought to defend the castle and Chikanori was killed .
#Text=Naotora was presumed to have difficulty securing clan leadership because of the innumerable resistances from the Imagawa clan retainers , so she anonymously seeks support from other clans .

#Text=After numerous threats from Imagawa retainers to Ii , Naotora finally allies with Ieyasu and actively participates in the achievements of the Matsudaira clan in Totomi and Mikawa Province . [ 4 ]
#Text=Naotora 's grave and other Ii family members .
#Text=Naotora 's actions were the most important moment for her clan .
#Text=She achieves Ii clan independence after more than two centuries serving the Imagawa .
#Text=Often Naotora is portrayed as an " unconventional lord " because of her numerous strategies and unusual attempts to protect and thrive her domain and people .
#Text=It is recorded that Naotora , being a former nun , often acted to avoid battles , earning the respect of many civilians .
#Text=She actively participated in the success of Ieyasu 's career that would later become the first shogun of the Tokugawa shogunate . [ 2 ]
#Text=In 1568 , Jukei-ni dies and the Imagawa enter a major crisis again and a year later Ujizane surrender to the Ieyasu 's Matsudaira clan .
#Text=Ieyasu led a siege to Hikuma castle and capture it from Otazu no kata .
#Text=Naotora is said to have participated actively in this battle to avenge her grandfather 's death , but it is probably a tale from the Edo period .
#Text=At the same year , Ono Michiyoshi who was Naotora 's ally , removes her from Iinoya 's leadership with the help of Imagawa clan retainers .
#Text=She escapes to Ryōtan-ji Temple in Hamamatsu .
#Text=During her days in Hamamatsu , Naotora gets Ieyasu 's help and recaptures Iinoya castle .
#Text=Michiyoshi was executed and his head was disgraced in public . [ 3 ]
#Text=In 1572 , Takeda Shingen personally invades Iinoya and other castles in Totomi and Mikawa .
#Text=The Battle of Mikatagahara took place near Naotora 's domain .
#Text=After days of resistance , Naotora surrenders Iinoya castle to the enemy to prevent bloodshed .
#Text=In 1573 , Shingen gets sick and dies in Naotora 's domain . The Takeda clan army retreats from Iinoya and Naotora returns to being a Daimyo .
#Text=In 1582 , she died of disease and was buried in the Ryōtan-ji temple .
#Text=Naochika 's son , the famed Ii Naomasa whom she adopted , succeeded her after her demise . [ 5 ]
#Text=In popular culture
#Text=Ko Shibasaki portrayed her in the 2017 NHK Taiga drama Onna Jōshu Naotora ( おんな城主 直虎 ) .
#Text=Ii Naotora appears in the Capcom video games Sengoku Basara 4 and Sengoku Basara : Sanada Yukimura-Den , voiced by Maaya Sakamoto .
#Text=She appears in the Koei Tecmo video games Samurai Warriors 4 , Warriors Orochi 4 , Dead or Alive 5 Last Round and Warriors All-Stars , voiced by Yuka Saitō .
#Text=Ii Naotora is featured in episode 27 of Meow Meow Japanese History .
